page.title: 01Whetty Coppice (ref:984 784)
page.content: { { This is a small coppice of mixed deciduous woodland, with an area of approximately 1 hectare. When the school was built in 1965, the owners of the woodland- The Bourneville Trust, made the woodland over to the Worcestershire Education Committee to be maintaines as an area of environmental interest. The woodland appears on maps dating from 1882, and has remained unchanged for probably 200 years.The dominant oak trees are about 18 metres tall.There are 91 in the Coppice, with an average girth of 270 cms.Other varieties include: Rowan,Birch and Alder.Shrubs show:Honeysuckle,Willow and Hawthorne. This area is of great environmental value to the school.
